text: In this video, we'll be teaching you
how to add roles on Discord.

Discord uses roles to
organize server members
and customize their permissions.
To add a role on Discord,
right-click on your server icon.
Then click on "Server Settings,"
then click on "Roles."
In the middle of the roles page,

there is a large blue button
that says "Create Role."
Click on that.

You can now give your
role any name you want,
as well as assign it a color.

For this example, let's
call this role Moderator
and assign it the color red.

Next we get to pick what
permissions this role has.
You can use these preset permissions now
or go to the advanced options later.
For now, let's use the basic.

We can also quickly add
users to the role here
or do it later on the full page.
Your new role is now created.

You can see a list of roles by
going back to the roles page.
If you want to remove one of these roles,
click the three dots on the top right.
And then, finally, delete.
To adjust permissions in more detail,
click the edit icon
next to the role in question.
Then on the top, click "Permissions."
As it's a moderator,
let's give this role the ability
to ban, mute, and move members.

You can give or remove
whatever permissions you want.

Make sure to save your
changes before exiting.
To assign these roles to a member,

go to "Settings" and
then "Roles" once more.
On the far left towards the bottom,
click on "Members."
Hit the plus sign next to which member
you want to add the role to,
then click the role you want to assign.

Their color and title will
change according to the role.
To remove it, click on the three dots
to the right of the name,
mouse over "Roles," and uncheck that box.

Now you know how to add and
remove roles to Discord,

adjust their permissions,
and assign them to members.
